mods:mods.mods:abstract: Feels Mr. HarperÆs address to his constituents about the Jay treaty fair and decorous, but wishes to clear up several points. Criticism of Jay, that partial to Britain and hates France, not true, rather believes improper to involve the United States in foreign politics. Has great esteem for British nation: American institutions, laws and principles of policy and government derived from their system. Has respect for achievements and talents of French people, despite the handicap of a long despotic reign such as that of Louis XV. Had long criticized the government in France and rejoiced in the initial revolution limiting power of the king. The second revolution disastrous and injurious to the cause of liberty. Wished success in forming constitution for the republic and in the ordering of FranceÆs internal situation, not the meddling in other statesÆ affairs. Hopes new constitution will give permanent stability to France. As for war -- does not wish that any power should have ascendancy in Europe. In the best interests of those nations and the United States that they limit each other.
